summary: This document is a chain of emails from 2020 between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing the handling of Touhy requests (requests for government information) from victims of Jeffrey Epstein involved in civil litigation. It details internal coordination on responding to requests, concerns about disclosable information, and the complexities of obtaining materials from other districts.

persons.name: John McEnany
persons.context: A key legal figure in the SDNY office involved in decision-making and providing guidance on handling Touhy requests from Epstein victims. He consults on procedures and reviews draft responses.

persons.name: Steven Kochevar
persons.context: The primary point of contact (POC) for handling Touhy requests from Epstein victims. He drafts response letters, coordinates with the 'Maxwell team,' and updates colleagues on request status.

persons.name: David Jones
persons.context: A legal colleague copied on emails regarding Touhy request strategies and approvals.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: A criminal AUSA involved in the Epstein case. He works with Steven Kochevar on Touhy requests, communicates with victim's counsel, and helps gather documents.

persons.name: Maria Lacerda
persons.context: Identified in an email as a Jane Doe victim who is a plaintiff in a civil suit and had previously been issued a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Roberta Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney (Robbie Kaplan) at Kaplan Hecker representing an Epstein victim plaintiff. She is the point of contact for the initial Touhy request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case. The document concerns requests for government information related to investigations into him.

persons.name: Sarah
persons.context: Referred to as a 'wiser Touhy head' in the Civil Division to be consulted on complex procedural questions.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Mentioned as having signed off on a Touhy response letter and document production.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Mentioned as having signed off on a Touhy response letter and document production.

persons.name: Jeffrey O
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney for the SDNY, referenced in the context of approving Steven Kochevar as the point of contact for Touhy requests.

connections.description: Legal colleagues within the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office collaborating on and seeking approval for responses to Touhy requests.
Work together on the criminal side of the Epstein case; Alex provides case knowledge and helps gather documents for Touhy responses.
Kochevar, as the government's POC, corresponds with Kaplan, the attorney for an Epstein victim plaintiff, regarding Touhy requests.
McEnany confirms Lacerda's identity as a Jane Doe victim and approves the disclosure of a previously issued grand jury subpoena to her.
Alex communicates with Kaplan to inform her about the Touhy request process and that she will hear from the Civil Division.

events.title: Touhy Response to Victim's Request
events.description: Steven Kochevar circulates a draft letter and documents for production in response to a Touhy request from an Epstein victim who is a plaintiff in a civil suit.

events.title: Identification of Jane Doe as Maria Lacerda
events.description: John McEnany confirms that a Jane Doe referenced in the Touhy request is Maria Lacerda and approves sending her a previously disclosed grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Follow-up on Victim's Touhy Request
events.description: Steven Kochevar informs the team that documents were produced to a victim a month prior, and the requesters have follow-up questions. The team plans to deny further production and refer the requester to other districts for S.D. Fla. materials.

events.title: Updated Response Letter to Victim
events.description: Steven Kochevar sends an updated letter responding to a Touhy request from an Epstein victim, noting the 'Maxwell team' has signed off on it.

events.title: Giglio Disclosure Note
events.description: John McEnany notes that Touhy communications with 'VB' (likely referring to a person or entity) are probably disclosable as Giglio information (material affecting a witness's credibility).

keyFacts: The SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office was actively handling Touhy requests from Epstein victims involved in civil litigation in 2020.
Internal emails reveal coordination with a 'Maxwell team,' indicating Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team was consulted on or signed off on government response letters to victim requests.

The office possessed FBI investigative files from the S.D. Fla. investigation but deliberately avoided obtaining files from the S.D. Fla. U.S. Attorney's Office due to conflict issues, discovery issues, and the prior non-prosecution agreement.
A Jane Doe victim was identified as Maria Lacerda, and the office approved sending her a previously disclosed grand jury subpoena.
Prosecutors expressed concern that some Touhy communications might be disclosable as Giglio material, which must be provided to the defense to impeach witness credibility.
